alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Newton; Oconee; Oglethorpe; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 9:43AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Oconee, Morgan, southern Clarke, southeastern Walton, northwestern Greene, western Oglethorpe, northern Jasper and southeastern Newton Counties through 1015 AM EST ... At 943 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Eastville to Newborn, and moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Madison, Watkinsville, Lexington, Social Circle, Winterville, Crawford, Rutledge, Newborn, North High Shoals, Mansfield, Bostwick, Arnoldsville, Good Hope, Bishop, Maxeys, Buckhead, Whitehall, Athens-Clarke County, Stephens, and Smithonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
